column2: Peripheral and intrathecal lymphocyte patterns distinguish CNS autoimmune disorders from primary CNS malignancies

The dataset contains multidimensional flow cytometry (mFC) data from the peripheral blood (PB) and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) of 81 patients with autoimmune limbic encephalitis (ALE), 148 patients with relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis (RRMS), 33 patients with IDH-wildtype glioma, 9 patients with primary diffuse large B cell lymphoma of the CNS (CNS-DLBCL), and 110 somatic symptom disorder (SD) patients. In addition, mFC data are available from the PB of an independent cohort of 20 RRMS and 18 IDH wild-type glioblastoma patients compared to 19 healthy controls (HC).
